intro: Castanopsis formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan chestnut. It is a deciduous evergreen tree native to Taiwan, belonging to the Fagaceae family. The plant features dense, glossy green leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. Its fruit is a spiny cupule that encloses one or two seeds, which are typically dispersed by animals. Castanopsis formosana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
